pageContext.claim: “Hispanics love what I'm doing because, number one, they don't want to lose their job. They don't want to take a pay cut. And very importantly, most importantly, they don't want to have crime. … That's why my poll numbers went way up with Hispanics because they really understand the border the best of anybody.”
pageContext.analysis: The NBC/Marist poll Trump is referring to, from mid-January, had him at 50 percent approval among Hispanics but was quite outdated by the time he made these remarks. It was also an outlier at the time. Other polls had Trump garnering much less support from Hispanics. A Washington Post/ABC poll at the time found 18 percent support. A Quinnipiac University poll found 35 percent. Most polls show that a large majority of Hispanics do not approve of Trump.
